Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
column7: The Board has adopted an Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy. Any material breaches of the Company's Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy are reported to the Board.

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column7: Magellan's Workplace Conduct Policy details the Group's approach to harassment in the workplace, including bullying, discrimination, sexual harassment, workplace violence and defamation, and provides procedures for dealing with complaints. On an annual basis, all employees and the Board undertake training to ensure that it is clearly understood what is expected of them in terms of behaviour and conduct in the workplace.

Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
Approach to tax
Tax governance, control, and risk management
column7: MFG and its wholly-owned Australian subsidiaries have formed a tax-consolidated group for income tax purposes. The entities in the tax consolidated group are party to a tax sharing agreement, which limits the joint and several subsidiaries' liability in the case of MFG's default. These entities are also parties to a tax funding agreement under which each subsidiary has agreed to compensate MFG for the amount of tax calculated as though the subsidiary were a tax-paying entity.

Energy consumption within the organization
column13: In 2023, Magellan launched an Energy Transition investment strategy to provide investors with a platform to invest in opportunities arising from the long-term energy transition theme. The plan offers clients access to a portfolio of global companies that are economically leveraged to the energy transition, can deliver tangible environmental impact by advancing the transition to a net-zero economy, and exhibit exceptional quality, as assessed by Magellan.

column7: To fully understand the issues facing a company, investors should consider environmental risks and opportunities that might affect the future operations of a company, including topics such as climate change, natural capital usage, water stress, waste disposal, the use of toxic chemicals, the formal license to operate in communities, and other issues that can impact the environment.

New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Magellan has an induction program for all its new employees, including senior executives. As part of this induction program, new senior executives will receive briefings on Magellan's business and its policies and procedures. These briefings will focus on the core governance and corporate structures and critical operational, financial, regulatory, risk and compliance issues relevant to Magellan.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: During the year, Magellan undertook an Employee Pulse Survey, followed by a series of focus groups that allowed our employees to discuss the themes that emerged from the Survey and provide ideas and suggestions for what they would like to see. It contributed to the next phase of engagement plans for our staff, the first of which was the launch of the refreshed Magellan values outlined in Magellan's Remuneration Report.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column8: Magellan Asset Management Winter Internship Program
column13: Two years ago, Magellan introduced a Magellan Asset Management Winter Internship Program to promote, engage, and attract more diverse talent into investing roles, initially focusing on women and candidates from diverse backgrounds. Magellan's Internship Program has been designed to give students an understanding of what it's like to work within Magellan's Investment Team and working life at Magellan.
